snippet: Dell turned in quarterly earnings that were better than analysts' diminished expectations, but it then issued a harsh third-quarter outlook. Plainly, we are moving away from PCs fast. The company is trying hard to move into the corporate cloud com...
abstract: Dell turned in quarterly earnings that were better than analysts' diminished expectations, but it then issued a harsh third-quarter outlook. Plainly, we are moving away from PCs fast. The company is trying hard to move into the corporate cloud computing world, hiring a well-regarded industry figure.

headline.main: Dell Makes Moves to Survive in Cloud-Centric World

snippet: Could Apple be better off if it loses its current patent lawsuit against Samsung? That is the point raised by a veteran Wall Street computer analyst in a new research report.
abstract: Could Apple be better off if it loses its current patent lawsuit against Samsung? That is the point raised by a veteran Wall Street computer analyst in a new research report.

headline.main: Why Apple Might be Better Off Losing Its Patent Lawsuit

snippet: Bill Gates, Liberty Global and Lux Capital are investing in Kymeta, a start-up uses a lightweight material to make antennas intended to improve satellite connections used for broadband Internet.
abstract: Bill Gates, Liberty Global and Lux Capital are investing in Kymeta, a start-up uses a lightweight material to make antennas intended to improve satellite connections used for broadband Internet.

headline.main: Antenna Company Raises $12 Million From Bill Gates and Lux Capital

snippet: The Times's daily business show looks at whether Facebook has lost credibility with Wall Street and the remarkable transformation of Apple.
abstract: The Times's daily business show looks at whether Facebook has lost credibility with Wall Street and the remarkable transformation of Apple.

headline.main: Business Day Live: Facebook and Apple

snippet: Comparable bookstore sales in the latest quarter increased 4.6 percent, the company said, helped by sales of the erotic trilogy and the liquidation of the Borders chain.
abstract: Comparable bookstore sales in the latest quarter increased 4.6 percent, the company said, helped by sales of the erotic trilogy and the liquidation of the Borders chain.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Narrows Its Losses as 'Fifty Shades of Grey' Lifts Sales
headline.print_headline: Barnes & Noble Narrows Its Loss as Sales Increase

snippet: Bowers & Wilkins, known for high design and high fidelity, has introduced the $200 P3, a lightweight folding set of headphones with a functional look and microphone for making calls on an iPhone.
abstract: Bowers & Wilkins, known for high design and high fidelity, has introduced the $200 P3, a lightweight folding set of headphones with a functional look and microphone for making calls on an iPhone.

headline.main: A Set of Headphones Clever, Cool and Costly
headline.print_headline: Stylish Headphones That Fold Away When Not Needed

snippet: A judge nullified an important plan to increase taxi service in the outer boroughs. It is now up to the City Council to fix this problem.
abstract: Editorial urges the New York City Council to rescue important plan to increase taxi service in the outer boroughs and northern Manhattan after Judge Arthur Engoron nullified it, thereby knocking a $635 million hole in city's $68.5 billion budget.

snippet: With many traders and investors on vacation, just 2.7 billion shares were traded on the New York Stock Exchange, where the 2012 average has been one billion more.
abstract: Stocks slip on one of the quietest trading sessions of the year, as worries about European debt return.

headline.main: Shares Waver as Worry Rises on European Debt
headline.print_headline: Shares Waver as Worry Rises on European Debt
